page.title: 15FARMING, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: This block is predominantly agricultual, and mainly arable agriculture. Apart from the one farm specialising in dairy farming, pasture is almost entirely concentrated in small closes around and between the dwellings in {East Barkwith}and{South {Willingham.}This unimproved grassland is cut for hay, or is used for grazing one or two cows, riding ponies, or a few sheep or goats. One farmer in{ {South Willingham}keeps a small herd of Lincoln Red cattle in such paddocks. In contrast, the arable fields are usually large, having been formed from several smaller fields, from which the hedges have been removed, allowing the use of larger tractors,ploughs, combine harvesters and other machinery which enable the farmers to work the land intensively, and economically.
